name: depart
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
B1 to go away or leave, especially on a journey: The plane departs at 6 a.m. The bus for Dallas departs from the Greyhound-Trailways Terminal.
More examplesFewer examplesTrains for Washington depart on the/every half hour.The train for Cambridge will depart from platform 9.We would like to remind all our guests to leave their keys at reception before they depart.The plane departs at 15.00 hrs.The train now departing from platform 13 is the 10.35 to Glasgow.

Idiom
depart this lifePhrasal verb
depart from something
Add to word list
Add to word list
to go away from a place, esp. on a trip: The last flight to Cleveland departs at 8 p.m. He shook hands and then departed.
If you depart from your usual or intended activity or behavior, you do something different: On the last show, they departed from their usual format.
